explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flashing point is 44degC (ICSC, 2003) (closed cup flash test), which is classified into Category 3, or Class 3 and Container III (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1171).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the flashing point is 235degC (ICSC, 2003)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transportat of Dengerous Goods, UN#1171)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 3017mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 5500mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1995), 3000mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1995), 3460mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1995) 2800mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1995) and 4450mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1995).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 3,311mg/kg (ECETOC TR 64, 1995) .

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapour) value of 16 mg/L (4,267 ppm) (ECETOC TR 64, 1995) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (5,000 ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.5 kPa (20degC) (ICSC, 2003), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation from rabbit skin irritation tests (ECETOC TR64, 1995) (PATTY 4th, 2000), although insufficient data available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation from rabbit eye irritation tests (ECETOC TR64, 1995) (PATTY 4th, 2000).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on heritable mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP TR 26 (1993).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of developlmental effects at dosing levels not toxic to dams in mice, rats and rabbits, described in MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 2 (2003), EHC 115 (1990) and PATTY (4th, 1994).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, kidneys, liver, testes)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "disturbance of the central nervous system (dizziness, loss of consciousness, tonic convulsion and clonic convulsion, etc.) and metabolic acidosis observed immediately after ingestion, renal failure observed after 2 weeks, hepatopathy observed after 3 weeks and neurasthenic symptoms lasting a year"(EHC 115, 1990) and the evidence from anima studies including "atrophy of testes"(EHC 115, 1990). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "a significantly low sperm count and higher rates of oligospermia and azoospermia in the exposure group compared to the control group"and "anemia and agranulocytosis found in 10% and 5% of the exposed subjects, respectively" (EHC 115, 1990).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 48 hours EC50>90mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =1.00*106mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
